name: ratseg
command-line: CYTOMINE_HOST CYTOMINE_PUBLIC_KEY CYTOMINE_PRIVATE_KEY CYTOMINE_ID_PROJECT CYTOMINE_ID_SOFTWARE SLICE_TERM MODEL-NAME MODEL-TYPE RESIDUAL

inputs.name: Cytomine host
inputs.description: Mandatory to communicate with Cytomine; automatically filled by server

inputs.name: Cytomine public key
inputs.description: Mandatory to communicate with Cytomine; automatically filled by server

inputs.name: Cytomine public key
inputs.description: Mandatory to communicate with Cytomine; automatically filled by server

inputs.name: Cytomine project ID
inputs.description: Mandatory to communicate with Cytomine; automatically filled by server

inputs.name: Cytomine software ID
inputs.description: Mandatory to communicate with Cytomine; automatically filled by server

inputs.name: Log verbosity level
inputs.description: Type and values depends on your software implementation, not set by server and must be optional

inputs.name: id of the term delimiting a slice
inputs.description: A number which is an integer

inputs.name: model name
inputs.description: prefix used for all intermediate results files (images, weights, stats, etc.)

inputs.name: model type
inputs.description: name of the architecture varient among unet, vnet, segnet, and mnet

inputs.name: residual connections
inputs.description: Whether to use residual conneciton accross the blocks of the architecture

inputs.name: learning rate
inputs.description: learning rate of the optimization algorithm

inputs.name: Model job id
inputs.description: Id of the job which has built the model (the job must have the model weights as attached file 'weights.hf5' and the following properties: image_width, image_height, train_mean, train_std)
